intro: Hieracium umbrosum subsp. mindinoicum, commonly known as the Mindino dark hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is known for its compact growth habit and distinctive foliage. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
